verses.text: 耶和華勉勵約書亞耶和華的僕人摩西死了以後，耶和華吩咐摩西的侍從，嫩的兒子約書亞，說：
「我的僕人摩西死了；現在你要起來，和全體人民過這約旦河，到我現在要賜給他們以色列人的地去。

words.note: Common in religious texts, though 'give' is common

verses.text: 你們腳掌踏過的每一處地方，我都照著我應許摩西的賜給你們了。

words.note: Common in religious texts, though 'give' is common

verses.text: 從曠野和這黎巴嫩，直到大河，就是幼發拉底河，赫人的全地，以至大海日落的地方，就是你們的疆界。

words.note: Often refers to Euphrates in Bible.
Often refers to the Mediterranean Sea in Bible.

verses.text: 你一生的日子必沒有一人能在你面前立得住；我怎樣與摩西同在，也必照樣與你同在；我決不離開你，也不離棄你。

words.note: Common in religious contexts, meaning God's presence.
Common in religious contexts, meaning God's presence.

verses.text: 你要堅強勇敢，因為你必使這人民得著我曾經向他們列祖起誓，要賜給他們的那地作產業。

words.note: Refers to a line of ancestors, often patriarchs in the Bible.
Often used for gifts from a superior or divine being.
In biblical context, often refers to inherited land or spiritual heritage.

verses.text: 你只要堅強，十分勇敢，謹守遵行我僕人摩西吩咐你的一切律法，不可偏離左右，好使你無論到哪裡去，都可以亨通。

words.note: To carefully and strictly observe laws or commands.
To adhere to and put into practice.
Often refers to a servant of God.
Implies smooth progress and prosperity, often divinely granted.

verses.text: 這律法書不可離開你的口，要晝夜默誦，好使你謹守遵行書中所記的一切；這樣，你的道路就必順利，你必一路亨通。

words.note: Emphasizes constant attention or activity.
Refers to quiet, contemplative recitation, often of scripture.
Often used metaphorically for one's life course or actions.

verses.text: 我不是吩咐過你要堅強勇敢嗎？所以，你不要懼怕，也不要驚慌；因為你無論到哪裡去，耶和華你的 神必與你同在。」

words.note: The covenant name of God in the Old Testament.
Implies a strong sense of divine presence and support.

verses.text: 約書亞首次向民眾下令於是約書亞吩咐人民的官長說：
「你們要走遍營中，吩咐人民說：『你們要預備糧食，因為三天之內，你們要過這約旦河，進去得耶和華你們的 神要賜給你們作產業的地。』」

words.note: Auxiliary verb indicating future or necessity.
Auxiliary verb indicating future or necessity.
Similar to '的', more common in classical/formal Chinese.
Auxiliary verb indicating future or necessity.
Reverent space often used before 'God' in Chinese Bibles.
Auxiliary verb indicating future or intention.
In biblical context, often refers to inherited land.

verses.text: 約書亞又對流本人、迦得人和瑪拿西半個支派的人說：
「你們要記住耶和華的僕人摩西吩咐你們的話：『耶和華你們的 神賜你們安息，他必把這地賜給你們。』

words.note: Auxiliary verb indicating obligation.
Reverent space often used before 'God' in Chinese Bibles.
Can refer to Sabbath rest in a religious context.
Strong affirmation, common in biblical prophecies/promises.
Verb-object marker.

verses.text: 你們的妻子、孩子和牲畜，都可以留在約旦河東邊、摩西賜給你們的地上；但你們所有英勇的戰士，都要拿起武器，在你們的兄弟前面過河去，幫助他們；

words.note: Auxiliary verb indicating obligation.

verses.text: 等到耶和華使你們的兄弟可以和你們一樣安居，同樣得著耶和華你們的 神要賜給他們作產業的地，你們才可以回到你們所得的地，以它作你們的產業，就是耶和華的僕人摩西在約旦河東邊日出之地賜給你們的地方。」

words.note: Reverent space often used before 'God' in Chinese Bibles.
Auxiliary verb indicating future or intention.
In biblical context, often refers to inherited land.
A formal or literary way to say 'what was obtained'.
More formal or literary than '用'.
In biblical context, often refers to inherited land.
Similar to '的', more common in classical/formal Chinese.

verses.text: 他們回答約書亞，說：「你吩咐我們的一切，我們都必遵行；無論你差派我們到哪裡去，我們都一定去。
我們從前怎樣凡事聽從摩西，現在也必照樣聽從你；唯願耶和華你的 神與你同在，像與摩西同在一樣。

words.definition: only wish, may it be that

words.note: A transliteration of the Hebrew divine name.
Used here as a proper noun for the one God.

verses.text: 無論誰違背你的話，不聽從你吩咐他的一切命令，那人必要處死。你只管堅強勇敢。」
